meanings.definition: In a mocking or ironic manner
meanings.sent1: She said 'great job' sarcastically after he spilled his drink.
meanings.sent2: He rolled his eyes sarcastically when his friend made a corny joke.
meanings.sent3: The cat sarcastically knocked over the vase, as if to say 'look what I can do.'
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered sarcastically, threatening to ruin the picnic.
meanings.sent5: Her tone was so sarcastically sweet, it left everyone unsure of her true feelings.

meanings.definition: Using sarcasm to convey contempt or ridicule
meanings.sent1: The sarcastically witty comment left everyone speechless.
meanings.sent2: She gave him a sarcastically polite smile before walking away.
meanings.sent3: The painting had a sarcastically exaggerated style that made viewers chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His sarcastically sharp words cut through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with a sarcastically awkward silence after his outburst.
